column2: You Too?, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking Enablex 1 1/2 weeks ago.  For many years I have been on lots of anticholinergics... Ditropan XL, Detrol LA, and Vesicare. With Enablex I got SOOOO CONSTIPATED after just 1 week and didn't even realize it was a problem until one morning I thought I was going to have to go to the hospital to void.  Worst yet, I'm getting large HIVES on various parts of my body.  They have a yellow center and are very itchy.  Some have lasted one week now, with new ones developing daily.  Is this from the Enablex???  I can't think of anything else I have changed in my routine.  It must be.  When I looked it up on webMd it said a side effect was 'Giant Hives' but they were rare and listed them as serious.  My next step is to stop taking it and see if they go away.  Anybody else having hives with Enablex?  They look like giant bug bites.

column2: BHP, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I had biopsy in February due to uncontrolable painful and urination urges.In August I was put on Detrol LA light dosage,it did not work,more pains and every 35-1 hour, especially at night,I had to go.It took me more than 10 minutes to sit on toilet and have a few drips out.Too painful all the times.One month passed,I had more constipation,dried mouth-throat,too tired with blurry vision,and not counting pain and trips to toilet room during the day.I quit going out or shopping because of prolnlem.Tehn in September 2008,my physician switched my med to Enablex 7.5 mg to see if pain reduced and flow-frequency worked.None,the same effects and I have been up and off to toilet room hourly.I stopped for a few days,I felt at ease and less trip to toilet room.It appears I have bladder ulcer now.Pain remains but to lesser degree. column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on 7.5 mg Enablex for 3 weeks now due to overactive bladder.  I would  get up hourly at night to empty my bladder and sometimes wet my bed or myself;  the daytime was not much better, with frequency and leakage.  Initially with Enablex, my bladder would be very full before I had the urge to void and I could sleep for 4-5 hours before waking...and no accidents.  I did have the dry mouth but it was worth it.In the last few days, I feel the old symptoms creeping back...was up 4 times last night.  My Dr. has upped the dosage to 15 mg and asked me to consult a urologist, which I am hoping will resolve the issue.In addition to dry mouth, I also find my skin and hair are dryer. I am experiencing mild constipation but have been able to increase fiber to address that, so it's no big deal.

column2: llmccal, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 68 year-old male that had prostate cancer surgery four years ago. Some cancer cells remained so I had 33 radiation treatments earlier this year and now have a zero PSA. I have been on 15 mg. Enablex dosage before bedtime for two years to treat frequent urination during day and night. I have had none of the serious side effects mentioned in other experiences and have had significant relief. My only complaint is that I have had a few occasions of significant leakage during the night. I do get up 1-2 times per night if I feel any degree of bladder urgency.  I would recommend that individuals with similar symptons give Enablex a try.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 15mg for approx two years now, and seem to have some relief of symptoms of over active bladder. The cramping has stopped, however, I have had considerable weight gain (about 50lbs since starting the medication), dry mouth, memory loss, depression and fatigue.  I dont seem to know I need to empty my bladder until its to the point where I am busting at the seams, then its urgent and some leakage may happen. I have also had to have a pelvic sling to help with the issue. Im starting to wonder if this medication is worth it. Last time I spoke with my urologist, she said to keep taking the medication and did not wish to change it.  Wondering what the risks are if I were to discontinue on my own.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Doctor put me on 4mg Flomax at first. Didn`t work after a couple of days. Still getting up 2-3x during the night. Then tried Enablex 7.5. Terrible side effects.Headaches/major swelling of the legs and feet/ dry mouth/ forgetfullness. Stopped the medication.

column2: angie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking Enablex three days ago and I dont know if I have to wait till it gets into my system? But I still have the urgency to go and when I try to very little comes out. I hope that it will work better for me as time goes on. But I think I would prefer to have surgery done!!

column2: Monica, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this medication for about a month.  It caused me to have SEVERE CONSTIPATION.  I told my doctor about this.  He said that Enablex was originally created for IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome) and not for Overactive Bladder or Incontinence. Enablex was originally a Pfizer Drug, which also has Detrol LA.  Pfizer decided to get rid of it because they didn't feel comfortable selling it for Incontinence.  As for controlling my incotinence, it didnt work for me.  My doctor put me on Vesicare 5mg and I have improved dramatically.  Vesicare works very well without the constipation.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication works great early in the day.  But seems to wear off by the late afternoon.  Even though I am taking the 15 mg. dose. Side effects are minimum.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: my doctor just informed me that since I have a family history of alztheimers/demensia, i should not take this medication as it affects cognitive functions.  as a result, i am no longer taking it.  be careful if you are having memory problems, losing a word, etc.

column2: Adam, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was having consistant urinary infections. Near the end, I started having the feelings to pee all the time and was negative for a urinary infection. I started off on a perscription Detrol LA. It helped, but I could not empty my bladder fully, I was needing to go every 30 minutes, and I felt I had to go instantly under stress and the feeling would not go away. Bad for work. I went to a specialist and I was put on 15 mg Enablex. It worked wonders after a week or two. I could last through 2 hour meetings. The feelings go away most of the time. I can last one hour under normal conditions and I don't have to go to the bathroom at night. There are cons. One, your bladder is not perfect. You need to go premtive before major events. You have to control you amount of liquid consumption. I only drink about 32oz a day and only from 5-8 pm during week days. Thank God for hard candy. There are minor side effects for me. Constipation about once or twice a month for two hours or so. Also, dry eyes wich can be fixed with visine. I have been doubling my dose for events such as concerts or major events in my life. I usually have constipation because of this, but it is better than feeling like you need to go or have to go multiple times when you are wanting/needing to be there. I recommend it. I just wish I was back to normal with the pill. I feel like I am 80-85% back to normal with the help of this pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Since taking enablex nothing has changed, my doctor swithed me to a higher dose but that was 2 weeks ago and still no difference.

column2: kelly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have been on enablex for 2 days and already noticed a difference.but what can i do to get rid of the dry mouth?

column2: 55-64 Male
column9: I have double vision in my right eye now. I'm gaining weight. I've had flu-like systioms and constant congestion. I'v taken this drug for 2 weeks. I have stopped and pray all this clears up.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I seem to have a combination of what everyone is saying...worked really well in the beginning, but the longer i am on it, it seems to "wear off". Also, i take it at nite before bed and for the 1st 1/2 of my day, its great, but after lunch, not so much! I still have accidents and urgency. 38 yrs old female..3 kids.

column2: 55-64 Male  (Patient)
column9: Male, 64 yrs, Overactive bladder.Two Enablex 7.5 mg tablets (one a day for 2 days) totally shut down my bladder. Hospital ER inserted a catheter. After 2 weeks, I went on Flomax and had the catheter removed the next day (10 hours ago).  Hoping Flomax will allow some urination and I won't have to go back on the catheter.

column2: kyah, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: when I have to go, I have to go.

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: Enabled, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken the medication for 5 months. I can see a difference. Still some problems but not like before

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication seems to work for me only part of the month.  When I get closer to my period it doesn't work at all and I find myself running to the nearest bathroom and sometimes not soon enough.

column9: I am still having to make hurried trips to the bathroom occasionally. There are also times when I have to go immediately, and cannot make it to the bathroom in time.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I seem to be having a lot of side effects from this.

column2: gotta go gotta go right now, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: have had an overactive bladder for quite some time and 15 mg medicine seems to have worked out okay for me but would like to know more bout the side effects if anyone has any answers...

column2: To Wet in Utah, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I switched to this drug after using Ditro-Pan, which I had used for 5+ years. However, I am having issues relative to urgent need to urniate (sometimes wetting myself) and not getting enough relief over a 24 hour time period. I have considered taking the medication twice in a 24 hour period and asking my DR about a higher mg...if there is one...Has anyone, who have had similar issue tried varying the routine of usage..i.e. taking it at night or taking more than 1 pill in a 24 hour time period.

column2: spinal cord injured, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been using 15mg Enablex for two weeks for a neurogenic bladder due to T-12 spinal cord injury. I had been on 15 mg oxybutynin xl that worked great but gave me very dry mouth so I wanted to try another drug that might not have this symptom. On Enablex, I have had lots of strong bladder spasms and feeling of bladder fulless, increasing  frequency to void, and three incidents of wetting myself due to not getting to the bathroom on time. After being on the drug for five days I thought I had a urinary infection, went to the doc and that was ruled out by a urinalysis and culture. It was suggested to give Enablex two weeks to work. At this point I see no improvement in my symptoms.

column2: Registered Nurse, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I like the way it works but for me it didn/t last long enough.  I would like it to be active a bit longer in a 24 hour period  It is easy to take.

column2: aj, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Very Dry Mouth.  Once or twice I was eating a muffin or bread product early in the morning and I had difficulty swallowing.  it was almost like I had no saliva to wash it down and it stuck to the back of my tongue.  Also, I have developed a rash on the back of my arms.  I am checking to see if it is related to the medication.  Aside from these issues, I have had wonderful results from the medication.
